com.optimizely.ab.android.sdk

Class OptimizelyManager

  • java.lang.Object

  • public class OptimizelyManager
extends java.lang.Object
    Handles loading the Optimizely data file

public static OptimizelyManager.Builder builder(@NonNull

      • initialize

        public OptimizelyClient initialize(@NonNull
                                   android.content.Context context,
                                   @NonNull
                                   java.lang.String datafile)
        Initialize Optimizely Synchronously using the datafile passed in while downloading the latest datafile in the background from the CDN to cache. It should be noted that even though it initiates a download of the datafile to cache, this method does not use that cached datafile. You can always test if a datafile exists in cache with isDatafileCached(Context).

        Instantiates and returns an OptimizelyClient instance. It will also cache the instance for future lookups via getClient

        Parameters:
        context - any Context instance
        datafile - the datafile used to initialize the OptimizelyClient.
        Returns:
        an OptimizelyClient instance

      • initialize

        @NonNull
public OptimizelyClient initialize(@NonNull
                                             android.content.Context context,
                                             @RawRes
                                             int datafileRes)
        Initialize Optimizely Synchronously by loading the resource, use it to initialize Optimizely, and downloading the latest datafile from the CDN in the background to cache. It should be noted that even though it initiates a download of the datafile to cache, this method does not use that cached datafile. You can always test if a datafile exists in cache with isDatafileCached(Context).

        Instantiates and returns an OptimizelyClient instance. Will also cache the instance for future lookups via getClient. The datafile should be stored in res/raw.

        Parameters:
        context - any Context instance
        datafileRes - the R id that the data file is located under.
        Returns:
        an OptimizelyClient instance

      • initialize

        public OptimizelyClient initialize(@NonNull
                                   android.content.Context context)
        Initialize Optimizely Synchronously. This one uses the cached datafile and expects it to exist. You can use isDatafileCached(Context) to see if the datafile exists in cache prior to this call.

        Instantiates and returns an OptimizelyClient instance using the datafile cached on disk if not available then it will return a dummy instance.

        Parameters:
        context - any Context instance
        Returns:
        an OptimizelyClient instance

      • initialize

        public void initialize(@NonNull
                       android.app.Activity activity,
                       @NonNull
                       OptimizelyStartListener optimizelyStartListener)
        Starts Optimizely asynchronously

        An OptimizelyClient instance will be delivered to OptimizelyStartListener.onStart(OptimizelyClient). The callback will only be hit once. If there is a cached datafile the returned instance will be built from it. The cached datafile will be updated from network if it is different from the cache. If there is no cached datafile the returned instance will always be built from the remote datafile.

        Parameters:
        activity - an Activity, used to automatically unbind DatafileService
        optimizelyStartListener - callback that OptimizelyClient instances are sent to.

      • initialize

        public void initialize(@NonNull
                       android.content.Context context,
                       @NonNull
                       OptimizelyStartListener optimizelyStartListener)
        This method does the same thing except it can be used with a generic Context.
        Parameters:
        context - any type of context instance
        optimizelyStartListener - callback that OptimizelyClient instances are sent to.
        See Also:
        initialize(Activity, OptimizelyStartListener)

      • stop

        public void stop(@NonNull
                 android.content.Context context)
        Called after the DatafileService is unbound.

        Here we just cancel the start listener.

        Parameters:
        context - any Context instance

      • getOptimizely

        @NonNull
public OptimizelyClient getOptimizely()
        Gets a cached Optimizely instance

        If initialize(Activity, OptimizelyStartListener) or initialize(Context, OptimizelyStartListener) has not been called yet the returned OptimizelyClient instance will be a dummy instance that logs warnings in order to prevent NullPointerException.

        Using initialize(Activity, OptimizelyStartListener) or initialize(Context, OptimizelyStartListener) will update the cached instance with a new OptimizelyClient built from a cached local datafile on disk or a remote datafile on the CDN.

        Returns:
        the cached instance of OptimizelyClient

      • isDatafileCached

        public boolean isDatafileCached(android.content.Context context)
        Check if the datafile is cached on the disk
        Parameters:
        context - any Context instance
        Returns:
        True if the datafile is cached on the disk

public static java.lang.String getDatafileUrl(java.lang.String projectId)
        Returns the URL of the versioned datafile that this SDK expects to use
        Parameters:
        projectId - The id of the project for which we are getting the datafile
        Returns:
        the CDN location of the datafile
